details.description: The RateLimitConfig interface defines the configuration object used to control rate limiting behavior. It was completely undocumented, with no explanation of its properties: maxRequests (the maximum request count per window) and windowMs (the duration of the rolling time window in milliseconds). This is a critical configuration type that consumers must understand to use the rate limiter correctly.

The primary public API function checkRateLimit(key, config) checks whether a request is allowed under the rate limit. While it had a brief inline comment, there was no documentation in the README explaining its parameters, return value, behavior, or usage examples. This is the core function consumers interact with.

The resetRateLimit(key) utility function is used to clear recorded request history for a specific key. It had minimal inline documentation but was not referenced or explained in the README. Consumers need to know when and how to use this function for scenarios like user account resets or quota resets.
